title.value: Comment: The bullet becomes hazardous for one frame
title.name: TEXT

title.value: upon striking an obstacle. It then destroys itself.
title.name: TEXT

title.value: By default, the first object tagged "bullet" will be used as the bullet class.
title.name: TEXT

title.value: You may specify the instance property "Bullet ID Tag" to override this.
title.name: TEXT

title.value: There are several instance properties beginning with "Gun" (uppercase) that control fire.
title.name: TEXT

title.value: You may automatically attach the weapon to an owner via the "Owner Tag" instance property.
title.name: TEXT

title.value: Otherwise, you can set the instance which can pick this weapon by via the "Collector Tag" instance property.
title.name: TEXT

title.value: Comment: Delay until state has been created and other entities are guaranteed to exist.
title.name: TEXT

title.value: ERROR: Weapon does not define valid bullet. Your game may crash. Set Bullet ID Tag under Instance Properties.
title.name: TEXT

title.value: Can't find any bullets to shoot!\nMake sure you've placed one in your level.
title.name: TEXT

title.value: Can't find any bullets to shoot!\nMake sure you've placed one in your level.
title.name: TEXT

title.value: Toggles the 'active' state of this tile when a message is received
title.name: TEXT

title.value: Calculates the velocity that should be applied
title.name: TEXT

title.value: to this tile when it is active.
title.name: TEXT

title.value: Each frame we check to see if this object is currently 'moving' or not.
title.name: TEXT

title.value: If so we execute the 'moveTile' method,
title.name: TEXT

title.value: otherwise the 'stopTile' method will be executed
title.name: TEXT

title.value: Checks to see if this object will arrive and the current location
title.name: TEXT

title.value: in the next frame. If so, then we switch the 'Moving Towards End'
title.name: TEXT

title.value: so that we go back the otherway.
title.name: TEXT

title.value: Moves the tile towards either the starting location
title.name: TEXT

title.value: This movement is applied through the physics velocity
title.name: TEXT

title.value: so that objects on top of it will move with this object.
title.name: TEXT

title.value: Sets the objects velocity to 0 which will stop the tile from moving
title.name: TEXT

title.value: Gets the first instance of the 'player-tag' from the stage.
title.name: TEXT

title.value: After a set period of time has occured, the 'getPlayerOffStage' method will be executed.
title.name: TEXT

title.value: Setting a higher 'Refresh Delay Time' will increase the games performance,
title.name: TEXT

title.value: since it getting a instance by tag can be quite intensive
title.name: TEXT

title.value: Checks to see if the player instance exists.
title.name: TEXT

title.value: - It would not exist if an instance with the 'player-tag' was not found.
title.name: TEXT

title.value: If the player and this item overlap then the 'complete' method would be executed.
title.name: TEXT

title.value: Default values of the public properties.
title.name: TEXT

title.value: Periodically will attempt to get the latest player by its tag
title.name: TEXT

title.value: Gets the latest player instance by the tag.
title.name: TEXT

title.value: When this instance collides with the player. Execute the 'assignKeyDoor'
title.name: TEXT

title.value: Executed when the player runs into the 'Door'.
title.name: TEXT

title.value: If successful, the number of keys are reduced
title.name: TEXT

title.value: The other doors are updated with the new amount
title.name: TEXT

title.value: And this door gets told to play the 'open' animation.
title.name: TEXT

title.value: Animation events to stop constantly looping 'open'/'close' animations from playing.
title.name: TEXT

title.value: Gets the required instances by their tag.
title.name: TEXT

title.value: This method will be executed every couple of
title.name: TEXT

title.value: Sends a 'TOGGLE' message to the moving
title.name: TEXT

title.value: tile instance if a moving tile could be found.
title.name: TEXT

title.value: Also animates the switch to its new position.
title.name: TEXT

title.value: Constantly checks to see if we need to update the instances by their tags
title.name: TEXT

title.value: if the player is on top of this object
title.name: TEXT

title.value: when the player presses the enter button.
title.name: TEXT

title.value: Gets the first player instance from the stage by the tag.
title.name: TEXT

title.value: After checking to see if a instance exists
title.name: TEXT

title.value: (an instance wouldn't exist if a player with the tag could not be found).
title.name: TEXT

title.value: If the player overlaps this object, message all the doors with 'COLLECTED_KEY' message.
title.name: TEXT

title.value: Gets the instance of the player with the tag set.
title.name: TEXT

title.value: Calls the 'updatePlayer' method after a period of time.
title.name: TEXT

title.value: If a player with the tag was found, and the teleporter is active
title.name: TEXT

title.value: then we teleport the player if he overlaps us.
title.name: TEXT

title.value: After a period of time we teleport the instance.
title.name: TEXT

title.value: Then after another set period of time we make the instance visible again.
title.name: TEXT

title.value: "ENTER" and "SPACEBAR both bind to action, for Amazon Fire support
title.name: TEXT

title.value: Use this script to make an entity into the player.
title.name: TEXT

title.value: You can use the arrow keys to move, jump, and crouch/glance down.
title.name: TEXT

title.value: You can use SPACE or ENTER to perform an action.
title.name: TEXT

title.value: An action sends the messages "ACTION_START" and "ACTION_STOP"
title.name: TEXT

title.value: to all registered "action listener" game objects.
title.name: TEXT

title.value: The "action listener" registry is a list. It is empty by default.
title.name: TEXT

title.value: Add game objects to the list by sending this object a message
title.name: TEXT

title.value: "ACTION_LISTENER_REGISTER" with the value of that object ("myself").
title.name: TEXT

title.value: You can enable or disable player input via "INPUT_ENABLE" and "INPUT_DISABLE".
title.name: TEXT

title.value: You can freeze or unfreeze the player via "PAUSE" and "UNPAUSE".
title.name: TEXT

title.value: You may attempt to play the death animation via "DIE".
title.name: TEXT

title.value: Unless another script sends "PLAYER_DIE_INTERRUPT" in response,
title.name: TEXT

title.value: the script will restart the level.
title.name: TEXT

title.value: We cannot use the "Dying Animation" property
title.name: TEXT

title.value: because that is defined after this listener is created.
title.name: TEXT
